comments:
for build 0831-1715a, and no CM

1. export a config which contains a plugin (config1)
2. rename the content element names and category element names
2. create a cp, then assign the cp to a renamed custom category
3. export the config again (config2)
4. create a new lib by using the fist export (config1)
5. import config2, it failed with the following exceptions,

!ENTRY org.eclipse.epf.import 4 0 2006-09-01 15:37:58.706
!MESSAGE org.eclipse.epf.uma.impl.MethodPluginImpl
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.epf.uma.impl.MethodPluginImpl
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.doAdd(LibraryImportManager.java:843)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.processDiffTree(LibraryImportManager.java:397)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.processDiffTree(LibraryImportManager.java:405)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.processDiffTree(LibraryImportManager.java:405)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.LibraryImportManager.doMerge(LibraryImportManager.java:262)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.services.ConfigurationImportService.performImport(ConfigurationImportService.java:161)
	at org.eclipse.epf.importing.wizards.ImportConfigurationWizard$1.run(ImportConfigurationWizard.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

the two config exports are under 

\\jinhua\shares\long\156014

to reproduce the problem, 
try to create a new lib with one export and then import the other config

An interesting case, but should not happen in the real situation. It would only happen when trying to import into a new library with a xml exported lib and then a regular configuration exported lib. Both exported libs were exported from a same lib before. The reason is that whe the xml lib is imported into a new lib, all the system created packages are newly created and have guids different than those in the regular configuration exported lib, even though their plug-ins have the same guid. This is fixable, but may not be worth the effort. Note that the xml exported file does not contain any info for the system packages
Need to fix this possibly after M5, so keep it open.
Fixed by replacing the GUIDs of all the systme packages of an imported plug-in which has an existing counterpart in the base library.
